instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: Hi I was working on a water damaged board and I relplaced a few items on 5v/3v rail. It chimes now and I have CPU activity mouse flashing. but no display I’m missing J9000 ( pin 3 0v, pin 4 3.3v) LCD_PWR_EN 0v at U9000 and SMC_LID is 3.4v L9080, r9008, r9009, L9004 all measure good so I’m guessing the lcd isn’t being “seen” I’m using a b133ew07 test screen and a “new” screen cable. if I remember the screen is from a 2010 MacBook Pro so I’m guessing this set up should work if I’m wrong let me know.

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
Test voltage at LVDS_DDC_CLK/DATA lines.
Check if both R9008/9 are good.
Be sure to test with compatible screen.

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: I’m sorry it was incompatible screen thank you for your time

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
Ok I received the right screen today 
I have backlight now but no image LVDS_DDC_CLK/DATA= 0v all
R9008, r9009 are with in spec I tested traces to and from the Filter/choke to lvds and from the test points They are all good.  I have 95ohms between 17/18 on lvds With screen plugged.

threads.message:

I have backlight the screen is dim.
Apple logo on back of screen is glowing but no image or Apple/ flashing folder.
You asked me to check LVDS_DDC_CLK/DATA I checked and it had 0v. I thought I was having no image

J9000 pins 24-29

LED_RETURN_1 =.681v
LED_RETURN_2 =.682v
LED_RETURN_3 =.681v
LED_RETURN_4 .=681v
LED_RETURN_5 =.683v
LED_RETURN_6 =.824v

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
"I have backlight now but no image LVDS_DDC_CLK/DATA= 0v all
---------------------------------
Pins 6&7 3.3v"
Is not strange enough for you???

Forget LED return, or other backlight stuff; you've got backlight.
Check L9080.

"95ohms between 17/18 on lvds With screen plugged"
Still the same?
If yes, change LCD assembly...

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: Ok I replaced it L9080 will try another lcd assembly could it also be the lvds?

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
If you get 95 ohms between pins 17/18 ONLY with LCD connected, guess what.
Could also be an internal issue inside J9000; present only when video cable is inserted.

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: Ok I’ll first try with just the Lvds cable with no screen connected. I will try the screen on another dead board for measurement sake if I get 95ohms then I know for sure it’s the assembly. I’m thinking more like it’s the lvds connector :/

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
ok I fixed the dead board and this screen does indeed work. So what can it be ? Bad PCH ? LVDS connector? 
Maybe I should Have startEd with what I worked on. Maybe I messed something up I repaired u6100, u7760, u7780, Q3380, f9700.  I got these for $5 each so they where missing parts and or badly damaged If you would like pictures of these areas I can send some
Thank you for your help you have taught me a lot and I appreciate your help. I understand how frustrating it must be talking with a novice

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
Post voltage and diode mode on pins 2/3, 4,  6, 7, 17, 18, 21/22, with LCD connected.
Do you still get 95 ohms there?

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
Do you really need to check pins 2/3 and 21/22 by separate???
Please try to understand a schematic and do not waste time with redundant measurments.

27V at pins 21/22 is good voltage for backlight.
3.3V at pins 2/3 is also good for LCD matrix.
All is possible only if LCD is correctly recognized.

Your problem must be the 95 ohms between pins 6/7.
If this appears only when video cable is connected, then you have a problem with LCD connector, video cable, or LCD display.
As you've said LCD assembly works with other board, then the only option is bad LCD connector.

BTW, check resistance between pins 6/7 in the other board and compare values...

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
Ok I’ll checked it again. but my working board also had 95ohms. When I connect the screen :/ I powered it up the screen works and powered it down removed from power and test 17/18 it’s still 95ohms.
I understand 2/3, 21/21 pins are connected but I just check it and post The values separately. Redundancy is my life’s work :)

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: Allow 10-15s (at least) after power is removed, before measuring diode, or ohm mode.

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: Ok thanks will do :)

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
Ok I Have PPVCORE_S0_AXG=0V it never comes up. 

I waited like a hour took the reading in front of filter on 17/18 on test point before it goes to the other side of the board all test between 95- 98 ohms higher values the further from the connector. This ddc/data line has been bothering me since I got this I’ve expected some sort of voltage on this line. Is it either waiting for some sort of handshake or data? Then Pch sends Out signal ? Anyway I ordered a new connector already.

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
AXG voltage only comes up under heavy graphics load.

As you have working board, compare readings between both boards.

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: Oh ok on my working board I have 1.14v 17/18 that’s the only thing missing on the non working :(

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
Check both boards in the same condition; LCD connected.
Be sure L9080 is good.

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: I tested again and I replaced L9080 same thing 0v 17/18 on bad board 1.14V on 17/18 good board.

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
LVDS clock signal comes from PCH; you should change it.
Did you comàre diode mode to ground readings between the boards?

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: Ok both boards measurements are equal in diode mode and ohms. Let’s say I was gonna attempt a pch swap what size solder balls would I use ?

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: Stencil must be marked...

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: Oh I’m using a bga stencil Or what I think is a bga stencil that just lines up. I will look for the Correct stencil and right down the size or just use solder paste :) thanks

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message: That BGA stencil, should have balls size marked on it.

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
Balls should be 0.3mm. Ball size should indeed be marked on the stencil, you can't use a random stencil, only stencil for 6/7 series mobile chipset will line up.
If you have a decent BGA rework station you can buy pre-balled PCH and solder it lead-free. Will save your time and sanity.

threads.title: 820-3115 not recognizing screen
threads.message:
Hi, I just wanted to recap. I wanted to find the exact reason why I wasn’t getting all my signals for lvds. I’m not sure this is correct but on pin 458 of u1800 I have a dead 0.00v short I removed (R2465, R2460, C2465,C2466,C7781,u7800) on this line and on u7800 Pin 1 (PP1V05_S0_PCH_VCCADPLL)
I still have a dead short. I’m guessing it’s directly from PCH. So I’ll go ahead and replace :) thank you 2informatico and piernov
